SUMMARY: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

Class Ext.ux.netbox.string.StringListOperator

Extends Ext.ux.netbox.core.Operator.
Defined in StringListOperator.js

This is the class that implements an operator that allows the choice of more than one value (from a list)

Field Summary
object editor
          With this operator I want always a combo with multiple choice.

Field Detail

editor

object editor
    With this operator I want always a combo with multiple choice. The editor that implements the behaviour is Ext.ux.netbox.core.AvailableValuesEditor If available values are not available (isAvailableValuesAvailable returns false) an exception is thrown
Constructor Detail

Ext.ux.netbox.string.StringListOperator

    It instantiates a new StringListOperator
    Parameters:
      String id - The id of the operator.
      String label - The label of the operator.
Method Detail

convertValue

convertValue(values)
    This method convert an old value of an elementary filter to a new value, suitable for this operator. NB: if you want to return an empty operator return []. In this default implementation, if it's an array, it returns all the element of the array in the format {value:...,label:...} an array with only the first element is returned. Otherwise it returns an empty array.
    Parameters:
      Array of Object values

createEditor

Ext.Editor createEditor(operatorId)
    This method creates an Ext.ux.netbox.core.AvailableValuesEditor as editor.
    Parameters:
      String operatorId - The operatorId actually used in the filter
    Returns:
      Ext.Editor The field used to edit the values of this filter
